body:
Hi Michael,



This issue is related to parsing Radiance materials from strings. Inside the [Honeybee source-code](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/honeybee/blob/master/src/Honeybee_Honeybee.py), parsing of Radiance materials from strings is done by the functions called [createRadMaterialFromString](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/honeybee/blob/master/src/Honeybee_Honeybee.py#L1011-L1042) and [analyseRadMaterials.](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/honeybee/blob/master/src/Honeybee_Honeybee.py#L912-L972) The parsing logic within these functions is only compatible with the basic Radiance primitive format documented in page 4 of the [Radiance File Formats](http://radsite.lbl.gov/radiance/refer/filefmts.pdf).

**modifier type identifier**

**n S1 S2 S3 ..Sn**

**0**

**m R1 R2 R3 ..Rm**



Aliases, which are mentioned in Page 5 of the same document, are not implemented in Honeybee. In the Grasshopper scheme of things, it is easier to implement a simple script that swaps out the name of the original (stored) material with the name of material in the scene.
